title: Waistcoat Front, late 18th century
medium: Technique: Embroidery using satin, stem and knot stitches in twelve colors of floss   silk and metal-wrapped silk; coils of metal wire, sequins (paillettes) and paste jewels sewn on silk plain weave foundation.   Trimmed with four color woven silk fringe.
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Waistcoat right front panel with a design of blindfolded Cupid being driven by a bird. Trimmed with polychrome fringe.

tombstone.epitaph:
Waistcoat Front, late 18th century.
late 18th century. Technique: Embroidery using satin, stem and knot stitches in twelve colors of floss   silk and metal-wrapped silk; coils of metal wire, sequins (paillettes) and paste jewels sewn on silk plain weave foundation.   Trimmed with four color woven silk fringe.. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-54-36-b.
